name: Glasgow (GLA) to Amsterdam (AMS) on a KLM Boeing 737 Full Flight
description:
Thanks for watching this Full Flight Experience!  In May 2017 I had the opportunity to take a research trip to the Highlands of Scotland and experience some of my favorite locales in the world!  There were plenty of opportunities for walking, exploring, and recording my discoveries, and the fun started even before I arrived.

This six-part journey continues after a fun flex day in Glasgow, a wonderful city to visit if you ever get the chance: many free museums, historic buildings, great food, and excellent people! No matter your interests, Glasgow is a great place to visit in transit or as a destination.

This KLM flight took off the following morning, Sunday, and takes out of cloudy, gray Scotland, over the English Channel, and into the Netherlands. Our destination, Schiphol Airport, is one of the world's busiest and most enjoyable airports to transit or spend some time in! The flight takes us low over the channel, over picturesque Dutch suburbia, and down to a soft, on-time landing, with the return to America just a few minutes later!

Thanks for flying in, and stay tuned for the final leg of this journey to and from the British Isles!

--------------------------------

Flight Information
Airline: KLM
Flight Number: 1472
Date of Flight: Sunday, May 21st, 2017

Origin Airport: Glasgow International Airport (EGPF/GLA)
Destination Airport: Amsterdam Airport Schiphol (EHAM/AMS)

Departing Gate: 36
Boarding Time: 08:58 BST
Scheduled Departure: 09:15
Actual Departure from Gate: 09:18 
Takeoff Runway and Time: RWY 23 / 09:27 
Landing Runway and Time: RWY 18 (Polderbaan) / 11:36 CEST
Scheduled Arrival: 11:50
Actual Arrival at Gate: 11:50 CEST
Arriving Gate: D5

--------------------------------

Aircraft Information
Name: Koningsieder
Type: Boeing 737-700
Registration: PH-BGG
Aircraft Manufacture: Mar 2009
Aircraft Delivery: Mar 2009
Engines: 2x CFM56-7
Seat: 8F Assigned / 8A Actual

--------------------------------

Gear
Nikon D3200/18-55mm
Canon Vixia HFM30
Edited in Adobe Premiere Pro/IrfanView

Aircraft, flight information, and facts developed from Planespotters.net, flightaware.com, Google Maps, and wikipedia.com.
